title: Make a Fire-Hardened Wood Knife
brief: Create a puncturing tool from hardwood using fire-hardening techniques.
steps: Step 1: Select a straight-grained piece of hardwood about 30cm long and 2.5cm in diameter.
Step 2: Fashion a blade about 15cm long, shaving it down to a point.
Step 3: Use only straight-grained portions, avoiding the core or pith.
Step 4: Slowly dry the blade portion over a fire until lightly charred (the drier, the harder).
Step 5: After charring, sharpen the point on a coarse stone.
Step 6: For bamboo: remove inner wood to make blade thinner, keeping the hard outer layer intact.
warnings: Use only for puncturing - wood knives cannot hold a cutting edge.
When charring bamboo, char only the inside wood, not the outside layer.
Avoid resinous woods which will taint food and leave an aftertaste.
